Field Label: Record ID

Administration Instructions:

Participants should answer all the questions as if the participant is wearing his/her glasses or contact lenses (if any).

An Appendix of additional questions may be added to address other sub-scales of vision-targeted health-related quality of life. For example, if a user is testing a new treatment for macular degeneration, by adding near vision questions A3, A4, and A5 to VFQ-25 questions 5, 6, and 7, the investigator would have a six-item near vision scale rather than a three-item scale. The addition of these items would enhance the reliability of the near vision sub-scale and is likely to improve the responsiveness of the sub-scale to the intervention over time. If items from the appendix are used, the VFQ-25 developers encourage users to incorporate all optional items for a given sub-scale. This strategy will enhance the comparability of results across studies.

Skip Question 1 when the VFQ-25 is administered at the same time as the SF-36 or RAND 36-Item Health Survey 1.0
PART 1: GENERAL HEALTH AND VISION
In general, would you say your overall health is:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , excellent|2 , very good|3 , good|4 , fair|5 , poor

Field Label: At the present time, would you say your eyesight using both eyes (with glasses or contact lenses, if you wear them) is excellent, good, fair, poor, or very poor or are you completely blind?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , excellent|2 , good|3 , fair|4 , poor|5 , very poor|6 , completely blind

Field Label: How much of the time do you worry about your eyesight?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , none of the time|2 , a little of the time|3 , some of the time|4 , most of the time|5 , all of the time

Field Label: How much pain or discomfort have you had in and around your eyes (for example, burning, itching, or aching)? Would you say it is:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , none|2 , mild|3 , moderate|4 , severe|5 , very severe

PART 2: DIFFICULTY WITH ACTIVITIES

The next questions are about how much difficulty, if any, you have doing certain activities wearing your glasses or contact lenses if you use them for that activity.
How much difficulty do you have reading ordinary print in newspapers? Would you say you have:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: How much difficulty do you have doing work or hobbies that require you to see well up close, such as cooking, sewing, fixing things around the house, or using hand tools? Would you say:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: Because of your eyesight, how much difficulty do you have finding something on a crowded shelf?

Field Label: How much difficulty do you have reading street signs or the names of stores?

Field Label: Because of your eyesight, how much difficulty do you have seeing how people react to things you say?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: Because of your eyesight, how much difficulty do you have picking out and matching your own clothes?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: Because of your eyesight, how much difficulty do you have visiting with people in their homes, at parties, or in restaurants?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: Was that mainly because of your eyesight, mainly for some other reason, or because of both your eyesight and other reasons?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , mainly eyesight|2 , mainly other reasons|3 , both eyesight and other reasons

Field Label: How much difficulty do you have driving during the daytime in familiar places? Would you say you have:

PART 3: RESPONSES TO VISION PROBLEMS

The next questions are about how things you do may be affected by your vision. For each one, I'd like you to tell me if this is true for you all, most, some, a little, or none of the time.
How much difficulty do you have driving in difficult conditions, such as in bad weather, during rush hour, on the freeway, or in city traffic? Would you say you have:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this

Field Label: Do you accomplish less than you would like because of your vision?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , all of the time|2 , most of the time|3 , some of the time|4 , a little of the time|5 , none of the time

Field Label: Are you limited in how long you can work or do other activities because of your vision?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , all of the time|2 , most of the time|3 , some of the time|4 , a little of the time|5 , none of the time

Field Label: How much does pain or discomfort in or around your eyes, for example, burning, itching, or aching, keep you from doing what you'd like to be doing? Would you say:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , all of the time|2 , most of the time|3 , some of the time|4 , a little of the time|5 , none of the time

Field Label: For each of the following statements, please tell me if it is definitely true, mostly true, mostly false, or definitely false for you or you are not sure.
I stay home most of the time because of my eyesight
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Field Label: I feel frustrated a lot of the time because of my eyesight
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Field Label: I have much less control over what I do, because of my eyesight
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Field Label: Because of my eyesight, I have to rely too much on what other people tell me
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Field Label: I need a lot of help from others because of my eyesight
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Field Label: I worry about doing things that will embarrass myself or others, because of my eyesight
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , definitely true|2 , mostly true|3 , not sure|4 , mostly false|5 , definitely false

Appendix of Optional Additional Questions

SUBSCALE: GENERAL HEALTH
How would you rate your overall health, on a scale where zero is as bad as death and 10 is best possible health?
SUBSCALE: GENERAL VISION

How would you rate your eyesight now (with glasses or contact lens on, if you wear them), on a scale of from 1 to 10, where zero means the worst possible eyesight, as bad or worse than being blind, and 10 means the best possible eyesight?
SUBSCALE: NEAR VISION
Wearing glasses, how much difficulty do you have reading the small print in a telephone book, on a medicine bottle, or on legal forms? Would you say:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1 , no difficulty at all|2 , a little difficulty|3 , moderate difficulty|4 , extreme difficulty|5 , stopped doing this because of your eyesight|6 , stopped doing this for other reasons or not interested in doing this
